intro: Fordiophyton multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the warmer months. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Fordiophyton multiflorum is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in xerophytic gardens.
